predicate.note: Frames file for 'land' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison to 'get'.

roleset.name: bring to land, from water or air

example.name: ergative
example.text: For all that, the piece landed unperformed in a dusty archive after Bologna refused to supply a chorus and orchestra.
example.arg: after Bologna refused to supply a chorus and orchestra

example.name: intransitive
example.text: At 18,000 feet, he says, he and his co-pilot ``were looking for an interstate or a cornfield'' to land.
example.note: This sentence is beautiful. It makes it sound like the pilot and co-pilot were flying an interstate or cornfield.

example.name: transitive
example.text: After struggling for over an hour, John finally landed the 5-inch trout.
example.arg: After struggling for over an hour

roleset.name: get

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mr. Wolf's success in that job helped him land the top job with UAL in December 1987.

roleset.note: I really don't know if the giver role can appear.
